Others: The Kansas City Royals clinched a playoff spot despite losing to the Atlanta Braves on September 28, 2024.
The Royals' remarkable turnaround came after a 106-loss season in 2023.
The team was led by Bobby Witt Jr., who had a historic season with multiple 30-homer, 30-stolen base seasons in his first three years in the majors.
Veteran catcher Salvador Perez also had a strong offensive season with 27 homers and 104 RBIs.
General manager J.J. Picollo built the team with a mix of players from the previous year and free-agent signings and trade acquisitions.
The Royals' rotation was bolstered by Seth Lugo, Michael Wacha, Cole Ragans, Brady Singer, and Michael Lorenzen.
The bullpen was rebuilt with players like Lucas Erceg.
Bobby Witt Jr. reached the finals of the Home Run Derby at Globe Life Field in Arlington, Texas, in the summer of 2024.
